page.title: 12LIFE IN DETLING I
page.content:
Detling is a quaint little village 3 miles to the north-east of Maidstone, in Kent. It is served by 2 small and friendly shops: the Post Office and The General Stores and paper shop; and the "Cock Horse Inn" public house. There is also a primary school for the local children, a modern and spacious village and an old picturesque church. A reliable, although infrequent, bus service runs through the village from Maidstone to Canterbury.
A short magazine, "The Detling News" and a newsletter are published monthly and distributed to all villagers. The W.I. and the over 60's club both meet on a monthly basis in the village hall and the Whist Drive, Badminton Club and Toddlers' Playgroup all meet weekly.
Although unlucky so far, the village is
